text.p: Here are highlights of stories reported by Hungary's press, based on information by Nepszabadsag's Hungary Around the Clock service. For further details on how to subscribe to Hungary Around the Clock, please contact Monica Kovacs at (361) 351 7142 or fax your request to (361) 351 7141.
***GENERAL***
ALL PAPERS
- Romanian Defense Minister Victor Babiuc stopped briefly i Budapest on his way to Paris.
- Three opposition parties plan to initiate a referendum on foreigners' farmland ownership.
- The social security authorities are expected to be constituted on schedule by August 18.
- Hungarian television will sack some 750 people this year.
- The weekend Formula One race achieved an about break-even balance.
MAGYAR HIRLAP
- The Ministry for Industry, Trade and Tourism is drafting a consumer protection bill planned to take effect on January 1.
NAPI GAZDASAG
- The State Audit Office will look into budget subsidies to state-owned Duna TV.
MAGYAR NEMZET
- The head of opposition Smallholders Jozsef Torgyan and Christian Democrats Jozsef Giczy will start talks on possible election cooperation.
***BUSINESS***
ALL PAPERS
- July CPI was down 0.1 percent month-on-month, up 18.1 percent year-on-year.
- Milling wheat futures prices on the Budapest Commodity Exchange surged on Monday.
- The BUX index tumbled a historic 550 points on Monday.
- MOL is investigating reports of car fuel pump breakdowns allegedly due to petrol quality.
- Egis announced its worst results since it was listed on the Budapest Stock Exchange.
- Pick Szeged Rt closed a successful half year with pre-tax profits up 32.1 percent.
- Mezogep Rt almost doubled sales in the first half of 1997.
- Hotelier Danubius's first half pre-tax profits were up 39 percent.
- Telephone operator Matav Rt will pay compensation to clients who use expensive fixed-base (RLL) radio telephones.
- Clients of mobile phone operator Pannon GSM will not be compensated for a temporary loss of service on Saturday.
VILAGGAZDASAG
- Privatisation agency APV Rt plans a Matav offering this year.
